An additional charge is due, you will be asked to provide a credit card number to cover the amount.

Advance seat selection charges are per passenger.

Your seat selection and any related charges apply, per passenger, to each individual one-way flight segment in your itinerary.

Tango standard seat selection charges are non refundable, except if:

  • you are moved to a seat different than the one you selected due to an involuntary schedule or airport change (e.g. flight disruption, cancellation). If you are moved from your seat for one of these reasons, you may request a refund for your seat charges.
  • you decide not to travel on your selected itinerary and you paid for Tango standard seat selection. The value of your Tango standard seat selection charge will be retained and can be applied towards seat selection on a future Air Canada itinerary.

Air Canada Altitudeâ¢ is designed to recognize Air Canada most frequent flyers with a range of priority travel services, lounge access, and upgrades that make your travel as comfortable and seamless as possible.

Air Canada Altitude is designed to enhance the travel experiences of our most frequent flyers. Open to world travellers, businesspeople, adventurers, dreamers, doers and curious people like you, Altitude is your ticket to an ever-growing world of experiences.
Keeping Your Business Moving Air Canada Cargo ships freight to over 300 cities internationally. From vaccines to cherries, we keep your goods moving quickly around the world.

"Air Canada Rouge is Air Canada's leisure airline and offers competitively-priced travel to exciting leisure destinations across five continents."
The vast Star Allianceâ¢ network makes everything faster and easier. Not only can you earn and redeem miles across the whole network, but every flight you take counts towards higher status.

Air Canada Vacations offers more sunny destinations in Mexico & the Caribbean than any other Canadian tour operator. Explore further with cruises, tours, car rentals and more across Central and South America, Europe, Asia, the South Pacific, Canada and the U.S.A.

You may sit in an exit row if you are:

  • 12 years of age or older;
  • able to read and understand English or French, and provide oral instructions in one of the two languages;
  • able to visually assess if it is safe to open the emergency exit;
  • free from any disability, condition or responsibilities (such as attending to another person) that may prevent you from performing the functions required to open an emergency exit;
  • able to operate and safely evacuate through the emergency exit, and willing to assist in an evacuation in the event of an emergency;

You must inform Air Canada if, between time of booking and the day of the flight, the above requirements can no longer be met. If for any reason you do not inform Air Canada, the passenger(s) will be moved from the exit row seat at departure time.

Children under the age of 8 must be accompanied by an adult (16 or older). Air Canadaâs unaccompanied minor service is mandatory for children between 8 and 11, and optional for youth between 12 and 17. Tickets for unaccompanied minors must be purchased through Air Canada reservations (toll-free in Canada and the US) at least 48 hours prior to departure.

Air Canadaâs unaccompanied minor service is optional for youth aged 12â15. If they are travelling alone, tickets for unaccompanied minors must be purchased through Air Canada reservations (toll-free in Canada and the US) at least 48 hours prior to departure.

Flex / Latitude
Standard advance seat selection is complimentary for Flex and Latitude fares, regardless of destination.

Tango - Sun/International
Tango customers enjoy complimentary standard advance seat selection when they travel on itineraries including Sun or International destinations.

Tango - Canada or between Canada & U.S.
Standard advance seat selection is available for purchase for Tango fare travelling within Canada or between Canada and the United States.

Preferred Seats
Located in exit rows, select bulkhead rows, and in the first few rows on select aircrafts, preferred seats offer more in flight legroom and are available for purchase.
Seats selection charges are non-refundable except for specific circumstances. Please read Terms & conditions for more information.
Seat selection not available for this flight
As this flight is scheduled to depart in the next 2 hours, seats can no longer be changed.

Passengers may not travel with a pet in the cabin when seated in an exit or bulkhead row.

Please note that you may be moved from your Preferred seat without notice in the event of an involuntary schedule or airport change (e.g. flight disruption, cancellation), to accommodate a passenger with a disability, or for any other reason that requires Air Canada to move you prior to departure or during the flight. If you are moved from your Preferred seat for one of these reasons, you may request a refund for your Preferred seat charges.

Your Preferred seat charge will not be refunded, in whole or in part, if:

  • you change your seat selection in a way that results in a lower Preferred seat charge;
  • you change your seat selection from a Preferred to a standard seat.
Gender and date of birth are required for all flights to, from or via the U.S. and for international flights over the U.S.
* Air Canada collects Secure Flight overflight information for reservations made online and via Air Canada Reservations.
to, from or via the U.S.
on a flight that is flying over the continental United States (excluding flights between two points in Canada) *
The Secure Flight Program was developed by the U.S. Transportation Security Administration (TSA) with the purpose of enhancing the security of domestic and international commercial air travel.

The Secure Flight Program requires that the airlines collect specific information and transmit it to the Transportation Security Administration (TSA) 72 hours prior to travel, or at the time of booking for bookings made within 72 hours of departure for all passengers travelling:

"
  • Pay $7 (all taxes included) for an Air Canada CafÃ© voucher redeemable for 1 Fresh Meal item or alcoholic beverage and 1 snack item (All Day Pantry or Fresh Snack). Voucher coding will be indicated on your boarding pass.
  • Use your voucher to purchase Air Canada CafÃ© items including alcoholic beverages on selected flights of two hours or more (duty free excluded).
  • Meal items are not available for purchase on flights departing after 10PM. On these flights, customers are able to choose from a selection of beverages and snack items.
  • Non transferable: vouchers can only be used by ticket holder.
  • Non refundable: once the ticket has been purchased, this option cannot be changed or refunded.
  • Your Air Canada CafÃ© voucher purchase will be represented by a voucher code on your boarding pass. You'll need to show it to the flight attendant to redeem your Air Canada CafÃ© selection.
  • Air Canada CafÃ© voucher purchase can be done up to one (1) hour before your flight's departure, provided you haven't already checked in.
  • Air Canada CafÃ© snack and meal vouchers are valid only on flights operated by Air Canada and Air Canada Rouge, and on Air Canada Express flights operated by Jazz.
  • Menu listings for Air Canada Express flights operated by Jazz can be found on the www.flyjazz.com website.
  • Not all items are available on all flights.
  • Please note: customers on Air Canada Express flights operated by Jazz of 2hrs to 3hr15min duration will receive up to $9.50 CAD worth of snack items from the All Day Pantry, as menu items differ.
  • Examples of the snacks found in our All Day Pantry menu include: chips, chocolate bars, and cashews. All Day Fresh Snack items include: apple slices and carrot sticks and dip. All are available for $3 to $5 CAD/USD. Examples of our All Day Fresh Meal menu include: pizza, and sandwiches, all from $5.50 to $7.95 CAD/USD.
